text: even at peace with the so-called Islamic
state gone Rocca is still deadly
dangerous few of its roads have been
cleared the fighting stopped here a
month ago but there are still mines and
booby traps everywhere most of the city
is a no-go zone hardly anyone has been
allowed to return but we made it inside
searching for a creel through the debris
looking for clues to the Islamic states
escape route the city hospital was their
last refuge and it's here where our
journey begins
the group's final defeat came thanks not
to a battle but a bus ride the convoy
left from here the city hospital they've
been holed up inside for months on it
where is fighters their families and
their hostages but we're told the mood
wasn't dejected it wasn't defeated they
were defiant it was here that they
realized that they might live to fight
another day
the deal to get them out of here is the
deal that no one wants to talk about
it's rock as a dirty secret
so did Kurds Arabs and the Western
coalition get together an agree deal
that not only allowed is to escape from
Raqqa but also allowed its fiercest
fighters to roam far and wide from the
confines of this city they left a city
lonely empty and in ruins the hunt
begins here in Raqqa but would take us
across northern Syria and beyond the
deal started with a media blackout the
Islamic states escape was not to be
televised but thanks to amateur footage
we see that this was a convoy and a deal
too large to hide the world was told
only a few dozen local fighters were
being let go no foreigners and no
weapons but the trucks were crammed full
of Fighters some wearing suicide belts
all were heavily armed after days of
searching we picked up the trail at a
truck stop on the outskirts of tadka
here we discovered the drivers all
civilians who drove is to freedom
they've been hired by the Kurdish led
Syrian democratic forces it was the
longest journey of their lives their
trucks were rigged with is bombs in case
the deal collapsed they've been told
they were picking up only a few hundred
civilians that it would be a quick job
they ended up driving day and night for
three days
everybody's been seeing only a couple of
hundred and the absolute maximum is

tell us how many new transporters we
we're 47 trucks and 13 buses and I as

well our convoy was six to seven

people including women and children tell
me about the foreigners that were on
these on the trucks we're really from
Turkey Azerbaijan Pakistan Yemen Saudi
China Tunisia Egypt there was a huge
number of foreigners this couldn't look
like the Islamic states escape to
victory
so the SDF insisted there would be no
flags and no banners instead I as

the axle on one lorry broke it was so
overloaded with is weaponry when they
made it to the village of Shanina they

hungry the is fighters clear two shells
we were at the shop here and an SDF

wanted us to clear the area as soon as

through there are about 4,000 people
leaving Raqqa on that road here it took

it was bumper-to-bumper kulish an
aircraft flew above them but did nothing
the convoy drove on we kept close on its
tracks for here is where is hoped to
disappear
they left the main road Mahmoud watched
as they took a dirt trail into the
desert as they passed they warned that
they'd behave the people who betrayed
them there were loads of vehicles I
couldn't count them all who took them
about four hours to pass through we've
been living in terror for the past four
or five years it will take us a while to

we feel that they may be coming back for
us or sant sleeper agents who is still
not sure that they've gone for good and
won't ever return responding to her
investigation the coalition now admits
that thousands we're allowed to leave
here but foreigners didn't escape it
maintains some of those who escaped have
already made it here to Turkey Raqqa was
their capital but it was also a cage
there they were trapped the deal may
have brought peace to the city but it
also allowed some of them was
battle-hardened is fighters to escape
not just Raqqa but also Syria and
arrived here on Europe's doorstep the
winds have carried news of the Islamic
states defeat but they bring with them a
warning and a threat from a smuggler and
a former is fighter after I scrambled in
Raqqa and ears or the smugglers here
noticed a surge in the numbers of those
who are trying to cross into Turkey they
are mostly is fighters and families from
Raqqa and Deir Ezzor
they are both foreigners and Syrians
the pair there are some French brothers

the Caliphate is gone but the Islamic
